result.execSummary:
All charges against Jerome Oneal Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerome Oneal Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Oneal Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Jerome Oneal
defendant.address: 7131 West SIlver Spring Drive # 3, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Robert Hampton

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Jerome Oneal Smith.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  State informs the court that defendant has been federally indicted, and there is a hold on him.  On State's motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Jury trial date vacated.
Motion to Suppress In-Court and Out-of Court Eyewitness Identification.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Jerome Oneal Smith not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND the expiration date of 90 days.

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in court, appear by video with attorney Robert J Hampton, appear by video.  Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective M. Martin.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State filed an amended complaint; copy served on defendant. Objections by defense argued. Court reviewed the amended complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense requests a preliminary hearing as to Count 1. Case adjourned. 



  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in court, appear by video with attorney Robert J Hampton, appear by video.  Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense request a arraignment. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Date provided by Br. 02 Clerk.  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Dismiss From Defendant (Jerome Smith 2022005859 House of Correction 8885 S 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132)

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing, Robert Hampton to be appointed pending conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Jerome Oneal Smith in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome Oneal Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defense motion to dismiss complaint.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS dismissal of Count 1.  Court DENIES motion as to Counts 2, 3 and 4.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
